newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Shenzhen A shares surge on bullish sentiment.
newsitem.headline: Shenzhen A shares surge on bullish sentiment.

text.p: Shenzhen's A share index gained more than five percent on Monday on bullish sentiment helped by rumours that Beijing plans to ease credit controls by lowering bank reserve ratios by the end of this year, brokers said.
Investors scrambled to build positions, believing profits of listed firms will pick up greatly in the second half of 1996 following the two cuts in interest rates earlier this year.
There was no trading in the B share market on Monday in line with the suspension of the Hong Kong bourse due to a public holiday.
The A share index surged 18.60 points, or 5.16 percent, to close at 379.12, with turnover expanding to 14.11 billion yuan from 13.03 billion yuan last Friday.
The composite index rose 17.31 points, or 5.16 percent, to 352.98.

Property concern Hainan New Energy, the best performer, soared 2.19 yuan, or 32.93 percent, to 8.84 yuan on trade volume of 25.02 million shares. Sichuan Salt followed, surging 1.39 yuan, or 28.96 percent, to 6.19 yuan, with 60.57 million shares changing hands.

Shenzhen Founder climbed 2.00 yuan, or 25.32 percent, to 9.90 yuan. SEZ Real Estate jumped 2.03 yuan, or 22.07 percent, to 11.23 yuan. Northeast Pharmaceutical dropped 0.25 yuan, or 2.17 percent, to 11.25 yuan on profit-taking, brokers said.
